trustfund:
TF037807-PHILIPPINES - AGRICULTURE
            SECTOR FOR ENVIRONMENTAL TRAINING,TF023087-PHRD-RURAL FINANCE II

abstracts.cdata!:
The project's outcome was
            satisfactory, while project sustainability is highly likely.
            Overall, both World Bank and Borrower performances were
            satisfactory. The generally successful project outcome
            underlines a number of positive experiences on which to draw
            and lessons learned in implementing credit projects in
            countries with a diverse banking system. First, use a sound
            wholesale institution with a strong accreditation unit to
            appraise participating financial institutions, rather than
            having the Bank review them. Second, this type project is a
            suitable mechanism for disbursing relatively large loans
            quickly to the private sector, without placing much burden
            on the government. By on-lending at domestic market rates
            and having the government benefit from the interest rate
            arbitrage, but bearing the foreign exchange risk, the
            long-term likelihood is that the government will not lose
            and that domestic markets will be strengthened. Furthermore,
            any benefits derived from the fact that a country can borrow
            Bank funds more cheaply than it could borrow commercial
            funds would accrue to the government.
